department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: RCF National Master Standing Offer for Ferromagnetic Detection Systems. The Contract provides for the supply and delivery of Ferromagnetic Detection Systems to various locations in Canada where necessary, as required by Government Departments and Agencies. A minimum Quantum is 100 units.
tags: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement:** RFSO E60PV-24FMDS Ferromagnetic Detection Systems

**Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

**Notice Type:** Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) with a Competitive-Open Bidding Approach

**PPA:** Please click on the following hyperlink to access the tender notice:
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20078424?extsite=MjAwNzg0MjRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Key Details:**

* **Title:** Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) for the Supply of Ferromagnetic Detection Systems
* **Procurement Category:** Goods (GD)
* **Description:** The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites offers for a National Master Standing Offer (NMSO) to supply Ferromagnetic Detection Systems to Authorized Users across Canada. The system will be available for delivery to locations across the country, “as and when requested by the user.”

**Contract Parameters:**

* **Projected Contract Start Date:** January 31, 2024
* **Projected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2027
* **Delivery Location:** Canada

**Eligible Contractors:**

* Businesses that are not yet registered with the PSPC may do so by creating a profile in the CCDI platform found at: [www.ccdlc.ca](http://www.ccdlc.ca) or by contacting PSPC’s Services et Approvisionnement at [central.bids.pspc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:central.bids.pspc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Submission Requirements:**

* Bids must be submitted electronically via Ariba Discovery with the Bidding Info attached to the bid. To access Ariba, log in through CanadaBuys (canadabuys.gc.ca)
* Bids must be received no later than July 16, 2024, at 2:00 PM EDT
